intro: Stillingia dracunculoides, commonly known as the Indian hemp or redroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a taproot system and produces capsules that contain numerous small, black seeds. Its foliage consists of alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy. Stillingia dracunculoides is often found in moist, wooded areas and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
